title: Maternal diet and lifestyle, levels of selected elements and fatty acid composition in maternal milk from two different areas in Slovenia

author: Marta Jagodic, Department of Environmental Sciences, Jožef Stefan Institute

segmentation: So what our babies eat is usually in case of nursing depend on their mothers, their maternal diet and lifestyle living environment.
All that can affect the quality of maternal milk.
But do we know how quality this milk is?
Is it quality enough to for optimal grow of and development of?
Our babies.
That was the question in our research, so we take.
Two areas of Slovenia.
The area of Cooper, which represents the coastal area and inland area of Pomaria.
The mothers give us detailed information about their lifestyle, about pregnancy, delivery there, and also of course about their dietary.
They give us maternal milk samples in which we detect levels of selected ascential and potential toxic elements.
The composition of fatty acid and also stable isotopes of fatty acid.
And what we did?
Cover we see so far that the levels of selected elements did not represent any health risk for mother child pairs.
The statistical analyzes showed that levels of arsenic and Mercury in milk.
Were higher in a coastal and also the saturated and monounsaturated fatty acid were higher in a coastal area than inland.
Um?
The buffets boolean saturated fatty acid, omega-3, and Omega six were lowering the coastal diner in land area despite higher intake of fresh seafood observed in the coastal but the ratio.
Between Omega 6 and omega-3, fatty acid did not differ significantly in between these two studies studied areas.
Our further work will be to.
To check for possible Association between individual fatty acid composition and stable isotopes with all these predictors of training through the questionaries in the research.
So for now, thank you for the attention and I would like to.
Introduce.
The next speaker speaker Igor Jokovich, with the short title.
How does Mercury get into fish?
